detaileddescription.para: For SWATT testing
SWATT bypassing used for testing.
CheckDwaxDiagAvailable function used to check the state of the car.

Function used to check in which state the car currently is. This check refers to VWMEB-41937. When the car is being externelly locked, diagnostics shall NOT be performed on listed in file header diagnostics request. When diagnostics are rejected, NRC shall be set to DCM_E_GENERALREJECT.
N/A
N/A
OpStatus
[in] - Operation status
ErrorCode
[out] - Error code which is forwarded to CAN
boolean - diagnose availability. If car is externelly locked, function returns FALSE (diagnostics aren't possible), otherwise returns TRUE (diagnostics are possible). range 0 - FALSE | 1 - TRUE resolution N/A unit N/A
Globals
DCM_INITIAL [in] - Indicates the initial call to the operation. RTE_E_OK [in] - Checks if the read of signals was succesful DCM_E_GENERALREJECT [in] - Indicates that the requested action has been rejected by the application
Input->Output-Correlation
DCM_INITIAL indicates the initial call to the operation. RTE_E_OK used to check if signal status are active. DCM_E_GENERALREJECT NRC code that indicates that the requested action has been rejected by the application. Used to set the error code if diagnostics aren't possible.
reentrant No context DWAX_Write_Adaption_0x0D1A_DwaxStateCheck, DWAX_Write_Adaption_0x0D1B_DwaxStateCheck, DWAX_Write_Adaption_0x0D1C_DwaxStateCheck, DWAX_Write_Adaption_0x1532_DwaxStateCheck thread safe No - protection mechanism ensured by DCM Handling multicore safe No synchronous
Call Sequence
Test Method
the following function is verified in
Verification criteria
The testcase shall be created to check that diagAvailable is set accordingly. TEST_DWAX_Adaptions__CheckDwaxDiagAvailable.
Traceability
Satisfies following DOORS Requirements:
Satisfies requirement
SWR_ICAS1_L3_ZV_1183, SWR_ICAS1_L3_ZV_1180, SWR_ICAS1_L3_DWA_1602
This function handles the condition read request for the Service (DID 0x0D1A)

This function does extra condition checking, before the actual read request is called. Return value depends on the outcome of the condition check performed. Session check is done by DCM.
N/A
N/A
OpStatus
- Operation status, not used by current implementation. Required only for DCM compatibility. range Dcm_OpStatusType resolution N/A unit N/A
[in/out]
*ErrorCode - Error code which is forwarded to CAN. range Dcm_NegativeResponseCodeType resolution N/A unit N/A
Std_ReturnType retVal - Value error code for DCM, standard return AUTOSAR type. range 0 - DCM_E_OK | 1 - DCM_E_NOT_OK, defined in AUTOSAR Standard. resolution N/A unit N/A
Globals
DCM_E_OK [in] - This value is representing a successful operation. K_LIN_DID_0D1A [in] - DID of DWA Sensor measure value 0x0D1A ConfigLinDiag_Read_Write_DID_buf [in/out] - Global buffer for LIN DK1/DK2 request and response data buffering K_SID22 [in] - Read request SID 0x22 K_LIN_DWA_SENSOR_ID [in] - Defines ID of LIN ECU: DWA SENSOR MESSAGE_0x0D1A_ARRAY_SIZE [in] - Array size of message 0x0D1A DCM_E_NOT_OK [in] - This value is representing a unsuccessful operation.
Input->Output-Correlation
DCM_E_OK used to initize retVal. DCM_E_NOT_OK used to set value of reVal when ErrorCode is a null pointer. K_LIN_DID_0D1A, ConfigLinDiag_Read_Write_DID_buf, K_SID22, K_LIN_DWA_SENSOR_ID, MESSAGE_0x0D1A_ARRAY_SIZE, DCM_E_NOT_OK are used to initialize rempLinDiagReq structure when ErrorCode is not a null pointer. In case of ErrorCode different than null pointer retVal is equal with return value of ConfigLinDiagReadWrite called with address of tempLinDiagReq structure.
reentrant No context DCM Task thread safe No - protection mechanism ensured by DCM Handling multicore safe No synchronous
Call Sequence
Test Method
the following function is verified in
Verification criteria
Test case shall be created to check retVal based on ErrorCode value and return value of function ConfigLinDiagReadWrite. TEST_DWAX_Adaptions__DWAX_Condition_Check_Read_0x0D1A
Traceability
Satisfies following DOORS Requirements:
Satisfies requirement
SWR_ICAS1_GW_20878

This function is called after DWAX_Condition_Check_read_0x0D1A and calls ConfigLinDiagRead function.
N/A
N/A

- Operation status, used as parameter for ConfigLinDiagRead function. range Dcm_OpStatusType resolution N/A unit N/A

- Buffer for copying response data, used as second parameter for ConfigLinDiagRead function. range uint8 resolution N/A unit N/A
return value of ConfigLinDiagRead function - Value error code for DCM, standard return AUTOSAR type. range Std_ReturnType, defined in AUTOSAR Standard. resolution N/A unit N/A
Globals N/A
Input->Output-Correlation N/A
reentrant No context DCM Task thread safe No - protection mechanism ensured by DCM Handling multicore safe No synchronous

This function handles the condition read request for the Service (DID 0x0D1B)

This function does extra condition checking, before the actual read request is called. Return value depends on the outcome of the condition check performed. Session check is done by DCM.
N/A
N/A
OpStatus
- Operation status, not used by current implementation. Required only for DCM compatibility. range Dcm_OpStatusType resolution N/A unit N/A
[in/out]
*ErrorCode - Error code which is forwarded to CAN. range Dcm_NegativeResponseCodeType resolution N/A unit N/A
Std_ReturnType retVal - Value error code for DCM, standard return AUTOSAR type. range 0 - DCM_E_OK | 1 - DCM_E_NOT_OK, defined in AUTOSAR Standard. resolution N/A unit N/A
Globals
DCM_E_OK [in] - This value is representing a successful operation. K_LIN_DID_0D1B [in] - DID of DWA Sensor measure value 0x0D1B ConfigLinDiag_Read_Write_DID_buf [in/out] - Global buffer for LIN DK1/DK2 request and response data buffering K_SID22 [in] - Read request SID 0x22 K_LIN_DWA_SENSOR_ID [in] - Defines ID of LIN ECU: DWA SENSOR MESSAGE_0x0D1B_ARRAY_SIZE [in] - Array size of message 0x0D1B DCM_E_NOT_OK [in] - This value is representing a unsuccessful operation.
Input->Output-Correlation
DCM_E_OK used to initize retVal. DCM_E_NOT_OK used to set value of reVal when ErrorCode is a null pointer. K_LIN_DID_0D1B, ConfigLinDiag_Read_Write_DID_buf, K_SID22, K_LIN_DWA_SENSOR_ID, MESSAGE_0x0D1B_ARRAY_SIZE, DCM_E_NOT_OK are used to initialize rempLinDiagReq structure when ErrorCode is not a null pointer. In case of ErrorCode different than null pointer retVal is equal with return value of ConfigLinDiagReadWrite called with address of tempLinDiagReq structure.
reentrant No context DCM Task thread safe No - protection mechanism ensured by DCM Handling multicore safe No synchronous

memberdef.argsstring: (const uint8 *Data, uint16 DataLength, Dcm_OpStatusType OpStatus, Dcm_NegativeResponseCodeType *ErrorCode)
memberdef.name: DWAX_Write_Adaption_0x0D1A

detaileddescription.para: This function handles the write request 0x2e

This function handles write request for DID 0x0D1A
N/A
N/A
*Data
- Data copied into first element of array ConfigLinDiag_Read_Write_DID_buf. range const int resolution N/A unit N/A
DataLength
- Length of Data, used for memcpy function call. range uint16 resolution N/A unit N/A
OpStatus
- Operation status, used to check if is the initial call of the operation and also used as init value for tempLinDiagReq structure . range Dcm_OpStatusType resolution N/A unit N/A
[in/out]
*ErrorCode - Error code which is forwarded to CAN. range Dcm_NegativeResponseCodeType resolution N/A unit N/A
Std_ReturnType retVal - Value error code for DCM, standard return AUTOSAR type. range 0 - DCM_E_OK | 1 - DCM_E_NOT_OK, defined in AUTOSAR Standard. resolution N/A unit N/A
Globals
K_LIN_SUB_REQUEST_MAX_DK2F_RESPONSE_LENGTH [in] - Max DK1/DK2 LIN slave response buffer size in bytes [DCM_E_INCORRECTMESSAGELENGTHORINVALIDFORMAT [in] - length of the received request message does not match the prescribed length for the specified service DCM_E_NOT_OK [in] - This value is representing a unsuccessful operation. DCM_INITIAL [in] - Indicates the initial call to the operation. ConfigLinDiag_Read_Write_DID_buf [in/out] - Global buffer for LIN DK1/DK2 request and response data buffering K_LIN_DID_0D1A - DID of DWA Sensor measure value 0x0D1A K_SID2E - Read request SID 0x22 K_LIN_DWA_SENSOR_ID - Defines ID of LIN ECU: DWA SENSOR
Input->Output-Correlation
DCM_E_OK used to initize retVal. DCM_E_NOT_OK used to set value of reVal when ErrorCode and Data parameters are null pointers. If DataLength is higher or equal to K_LIN_SUB_REQUEST_MAX_DK2F_RESPONSE_LENGTH then ErrorCode will be set to DCM_E_INCORRECTMESSAGELENGTHORINVALIDFORMAT and retVal to DCM_E_NOT_OK. When DataLength is less than K_LIN_SUB_REQUEST_MAX_DK2F_RESPONSE_LENGTH and Data, ErrorCode are not null pointers then if OpStatus is DCM_INITIAL then Data will be copied into first element of array ConfigLinDiag_Read_Write_DID_buf. K_LIN_DID_0D1A, ConfigLinDiag_Read_Write_DID_buf, K_SID2E, K_LIN_DWA_SENSOR_ID are used to initialize structure tempLinDiagReq which address is passed as parameter to ConfigLinDiagReadWrite function and saves the return value into retVal.
reentrant No context DWAX_Write_Adaption_0x0D1A_DwaxStateCheck thread safe No - protection mechanism ensured by DCM Handling multicore safe No synchronous
Call Sequence
Test Method
the following function is verified in
Verification criteria
Test case shall be created to check retVal based on ErrorCode, Data, DataLength and OpStatus parameters values and return value of function ConfigLinDiagReadWrite. TEST_DWAX_Adaptions__DWAX_Write_Adaption_0x0D1A
Traceability
Satisfies following DOORS Requirements:
Satisfies requirement
SWR_ICAS1_GW_20878

memberdef.name: DWAX_Write_Adaption_0x0D1B

detaileddescription.para: This function handles the write request 0x2e

This function handles write request for DID 0x0D1B
N/A
N/A
*Data
- Data copied into first element of array ConfigLinDiag_Read_Write_DID_buf. range const int resolution N/A unit N/A
DataLength
- Length of Data, used for memcpy function call. range uint16 resolution N/A unit N/A
OpStatus
- Operation status, used to check if is the initial call of the operation and also used as init value for tempLinDiagReq structure . range Dcm_OpStatusType resolution N/A unit N/A
[in/out]
*ErrorCode - Error code which is forwarded to CAN. range Dcm_NegativeResponseCodeType resolution N/A unit N/A
Std_ReturnType retVal - Value error code for DCM, standard return AUTOSAR type. range 0 - DCM_E_OK | 1 - DCM_E_NOT_OK, defined in AUTOSAR Standard. resolution N/A unit N/A
Globals
K_LIN_SUB_REQUEST_MAX_DK2F_RESPONSE_LENGTH [in] - Max DK1/DK2 LIN slave response buffer size in bytes [DCM_E_INCORRECTMESSAGELENGTHORINVALIDFORMAT [in] - length of the received request message does not match the prescribed length for the specified service DCM_E_NOT_OK [in] - This value is representing a unsuccessful operation. DCM_INITIAL [in] - Indicates the initial call to the operation. ConfigLinDiag_Read_Write_DID_buf [in/out] - Global buffer for LIN DK1/DK2 request and response data buffering K_LIN_DID_0D1B - DID of DWA Sensor measure value 0x0D1B K_SID2E - Read request SID 0x22 K_LIN_DWA_SENSOR_ID - Defines ID of LIN ECU: DWA SENSOR
Input->Output-Correlation
DCM_E_OK used to initize retVal. DCM_E_NOT_OK used to set value of reVal when ErrorCode and Data parameters are null pointers. If DataLength is higher or equal to K_LIN_SUB_REQUEST_MAX_DK2F_RESPONSE_LENGTH then ErrorCode will be set to DCM_E_INCORRECTMESSAGELENGTHORINVALIDFORMAT and retVal to DCM_E_NOT_OK. When DataLength is less than K_LIN_SUB_REQUEST_MAX_DK2F_RESPONSE_LENGTH and Data, ErrorCode are not null pointers then if OpStatus is DCM_INITIAL then Data will be copied into first element of array ConfigLinDiag_Read_Write_DID_buf. K_LIN_DID_0D1B, ConfigLinDiag_Read_Write_DID_buf, K_SID2E, K_LIN_DWA_SENSOR_ID are used to initialize structure tempLinDiagReq which address is passed as parameter to ConfigLinDiagReadWrite function and saves the return value into retVal.

DCM_E_OK used to initize retVal. DCM_E_NOT_OK used to set value of reVal when ErrorCode and Data parameters are null pointers. If DataLength is higher or equal to K_LIN_SUB_REQUEST_MAX_DK2F_RESPONSE_LENGTH then ErrorCode will be set to DCM_E_INCORRECTMESSAGELENGTHORINVALIDFORMAT and retVal to DCM_E_NOT_OK. When DataLength is less than K_LIN_SUB_REQUEST_MAX_DK2F_RESPONSE_LENGTH and Data, ErrorCode are not null pointers then if OpStatus is DCM_INITIAL then Data will be copied into first element of array ConfigLinDiag_Read_Write_DID_buf. K_LIN_DID_1532, ConfigLinDiag_Read_Write_DID_buf, K_SID2E, K_LIN_DWA_SENSOR_ID are used to initialize structure tempLinDiagReq which address is passed as parameter to ConfigLinDiagReadWrite function and saves the return value into retVal.
reentrant No context DWAX_Write_Adaption_0x1532_DwaxStateCheck thread safe No - protection mechanism ensured by DCM Handling multicore safe No synchronous
Call Sequence
Test Method
the following function is verified in
Verification criteria
Test case shall be created to check retVal based on ErrorCode, Data, DataLength and OpStatus parameters values and return value of function ConfigLinDiagReadWrite. TEST_DWAX_Adaptions__DWAX_Write_Adaption_0x1532
Traceability
Satisfies following DOORS Requirements:
Satisfies requirement
SWR_ICAS1_GW_20852
